channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WI

item.title: Report E-2023110089
item.description:
Report E-2023110089

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-23
  • City: SHEBOYGAN
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: About 25 gallons of "Wonderbond Hrdnr M 318LY" spilled from a 55gal plastic drum onto the inside of the trailer due to a forklift puncture. A contractor was contacted to assist with the cleanup of material.

item.title: Report E-2023110056
item.description:
Report E-2023110056

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-24
  • City: MENOMONEE FALLS
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: An employee was offloading a trailer at Veolia's facility in Menomonee Falls, WI when a leaking container was discovered. An IBC full of inner packages containing paint had leaked about 1 gallon of liquid onto the floor of the trailer. The spill was cleaned up and reported to the EHS team. Upon investigation, it was found that several of the inner paint containers did not have lids or were not closed properly. The inner containers had also shifted during the transportation process.

item.title: Report X-2023101502
item.description:
Report X-2023101502

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-25
  • City: OAK CREEK
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED FOR HAZMAT ON GREEN BELT THAT WAS LEAKING. SPILL WAS CONTAINED AND TAKEN TO DMP FOR PROCESSING. DURING CLEAN UP AND INSPECTION RESPONDER DISCOVERED ALL OF THE BOTTLES HAD TAPE AROUND THE CAPS BUT ONE OF THE BOTTLES HAD A LOOSE CAP UNDER THE TAPE. RESPONDER PROCESSED THROUGH DMP.

item.title: Report X-2023110077
item.description:
Report X-2023110077

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-23
  • City: MADISON
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to QA area in a black bin with a plastic liner. Package was leaking white paint. DescribePack: Two 3.5-liter cans in the package were dented and were leaking from their tops. Closures on the paint cans were loose and falling off. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a bin with a plastic liner to contain the spillage.

item.title: Report X-2023101223
item.description:
Report X-2023101223

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-18
  • City: OAK CREEK
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED ON THE SOUTH INDUCT. AFTER IT WAS BROUGHT TO THE DMP, WAS DESCOVERED TO HAVE A DAMAGED AEROSOL CAN, AND NO LIMITED QUANTITY MARKINGS. THE OUTER PACKAGING WAS A USED BOX. THE RESPONDER THEN CALLED IT IN TO THE UPS HAZMAT LINE, CONFIRMED UNDECLARED.
